  • Constructor Details

    • Console

      public Console()

  • Method Details

    • print

      public static void print(Object input)
      Print text to the console screen and don't go to the next line.
      Parameters:
      input - The object you send will convert to String.

    • println

      public static void println(Object input)
      Print text to the console screen and go to the next line.
      Parameters:
      input - The object you send will convert to the String.

    • printList

      public static void printList(List<String> list, boolean lineNumber, boolean nextLine)
      Prints entire list to the console screen.
      Parameters:
      list - The list you want to print.
      lineNumber - Enable this if you want to show the line numbers.
      nextLine - Set this true to go to next line.

    • printCharacters

      public static void printCharacters(char c, int len, boolean nextLine)
      Print sequence of characters to the console screen.
      Parameters:
      c - The character you want to print.
      len - The number of times that print must be repeated.
      nextLine - Enable this if you want to go to the next line after printing completed.

    • clear

      public static void clear(int line)
      Clears screen with limited of lines.
      Parameters:
      line - The lines you want to push text to the top.

    • pressEnter

      public static void pressEnter()
      Print message and wait for the user to press enter from the keyboard.

    • pressEnter

      public static void pressEnter(String message)
      Print message and wait for the user to press enter from the keyboard.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to print before user hits enter.

    • sure

      public static boolean sure(String message, boolean repeat)
      Ask user if he/she sure about continue to do something.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to say to the user.
      repeat - Enable this if user enters incorrect option and repeat process.
      Returns:
      Returns true if user selects yes otherwise it will return false.

    • ask

      public static int ask(String message, List<String> options, boolean repeat)
      Ask user multiple options and wait for user to select one of it.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to say to the user.
      options - The options you want user to select one of them.
      repeat - Enable this if user enters incorrect option and repeat process.
      Returns:
      Returns the index of selected option or -1 if none of them were true.

    • read

      public String read()
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.

    • read

      public String read(String message)
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to show the user before reading input.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.

    • read

      public String read(String message, boolean trim)
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to show the user before reading input.
      trim - Enable this if you want to cut invalid spaces at the end of input.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.

    • readPassword

      public String readPassword() throws UnsupportedConsoleException
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedConsoleException - Throws exception if current console is not supported for reading password.

    • readPassword

      public String readPassword(String message) throws UnsupportedConsoleException
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to show the user before reading input.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedConsoleException - Throws exception if current console is not supported for reading password.

    • readPassword

      public String readPassword(String message, boolean trim) throws UnsupportedConsoleException
      Reads password from terminal without showing user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message you want to show the user before reading input.
      trim - Enable this if you want to cut invalid spaces at the end of input.
      Returns:
      Returns the input get from user.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedConsoleException - Throws exception if current console is not supported for reading password.
